name: geranium
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
a plant with red, pink, or white flowers whose two upper petals are different from their three lower petals, often grown in containers and gardens: Good choices to grow in pots are begonias, geraniums, or philodendrons. She had window boxes full of scarlet geraniums. Synonym
pelargonium
Floortje/iStock / Getty Images Plus/GettyImages
a plant whose flowers are pink, purple, white, or blue and have five petals that are all similar: For a shady area under the trees where nothing seems to grow, try the cranesbill or geranium. There were beautiful wildflowers such as yellow poppies, wild geraniums, forget-me-nots, and tiny wild violas. Synonym
cranesbill
More examplesFewer examplesBright geraniums waved in a painted white planter.There were terracotta pots on the terraces and geraniums spilling over a balcony.Sweet scented geraniums smell wonderful every time you brush against them.
